Others: Walker did not throw a single pitch in the postseason after going 15-6 with a 4.33 ERA in his first season in Philadelphia.
The team passed over him for a Game 4 start despite making Walker its prized offseason pitching acquisition with a four-year, $72 million deal during the 2022 Winter Meetings.
Walker's ERA jumped up nearly a full run compared to his previous season.
Walker wasn't pitching his best baseball going into the postseason, with a 5.91 ERA in September while posting his worst walks per nine innings ratio since 2014.
